title: Dear, so now it is not possible to use five devices under the same account?
body: Dear, so now it is not possible to use five devices under the same account?
author: youngyeh310

comments.body: Install extension - login - copy your nodeid - delete extension, repeat till 5 node in your account.

satisfaction_conditions: A method to use the same account across five devices
A step-by-step process that works within the current system constraints

title: Can multiple proxies run on 1 usertoken?
body:
I have a question: if a userToken has one nodeId and one hardwareId, can it run multiple proxies? Will it receive multiple rewards?
Or can each userToken, nodeId, and hardwareId only run on one proxy?

Thanks for reading. I look forward to your reply.
author: lenhu96

comments.body: 1 nodeid is only can run 1 process, so you can't run 1 nodeid with multiple proxies. But usertoken can run multiple different nodeid (5 max)

Thank you for sharing.
But I noticed in the config.js file, there is a format like the one below:

javascript
Copy code
usertoken: 'usertoken1',
nodes: [
    { nodeId: 'nodeid1', hardwareId: 'hardwareid1', proxy: 'proxy1' },
    { nodeId: 'nodeid2', hardwareId: 'hardwareid2', proxy: 'proxy2' },
    { nodeId: 'nodeid3', hardwareId: 'hardwareid3', proxy: 'proxy3' },
    { nodeId: 'nodeid4', hardwareId: 'hardwareid4', proxy: 'proxy4' },
    { nodeId: 'nodeid5', hardwareId: 'hardwareid5', proxy: 'proxy5' }
]
From this, I see that on the same PC, if there are 2 browsers, there will be 2 userTokens and 2 nodeIds but the same hardwareId.
So, in what situation would there be a case like the format you shared, where one userToken has multiple nodeIds?

I hope you understand as I still donâ€™t fully grasp it.
Looking forward to your response.

Thank you very much.

You only need one usertoken for one account, each time you login the account in the different browser or device you will have a different usertoken, just copy one. For nodeid, each extension installation will have a different nodeid and hardwareid comes from the hardware identification of your device, you will need to install extension in different device to have different hardwareid.

I got it
Awesome
Thanks for sharing
Love you <3

satisfaction_conditions: Clear explanation of the relationship between usertoken, nodeId, and hardwareId
Clarification on the maximum number of proxies that can be run with a single configuration
Explanation of how the config.js file structure relates to real-world usage
Information about how hardware identification works across different devices

title: Can i run more than one nodeid?
body: Can i run more than one node id at the same time? Coz when i put second nodeid in the new line it doean't react

comments.body: no, I only test using one node id. maybe I will make it to support multi nodeid/hardwareid later when I have time
